file_content.text: Go to the security center. Quickly.
So that was the leader of Directive Seven.
Yes--part of him, at any rate. His intelligence has merged with practically everything in this facility.
He is still dependent on a central processing core, though--that is where you'll have to strike. The only way to stop Mentor's revolution is to destroy Mentor himself.
How can we destroy him in time?
Then let's not waste time.
It sounds like his intelligence is too spread out to have a single weak spot.
Are you sure it will work?
Your body has many systems, but your brain controls them all. Mentor is no different.
I hope I can make that pompous machine suffer before the end.
It will be a pleasure.
Given our limited time, I would not suggest it.
The core of Mentor's intelligence is very heavily secured. The only way to gain access is through the security center.
I'll do my best to distract him while you unlock the core, but be prepared for extensive fighting. He doesn't fear you yet, but he will learn quickly.
The more droids he sends, the more times I will have the pleasure of destroying him.
I will crush any in my path.
Do not savor the killing for too long.
Mentor clearly requires an education in the power of the dark side.
He'll learn very quickly.
Do not waste time on overzealous displays of power.
The more droids I smash, the more I can charge for coming here.
Extra kills, extra profit.
Time should be your primary concern now, not personal profit.
The longer we can keep him complacent, the better.
I'll keep a low profile.
I agree, but we do not have much time.
How soon will Mentor transmit his signal?
How much time do we have?
You have to be able to do more than distract him.
Surely you can do more.
I was not designed for combat. I will do everything else that I can manage.
As soon as Mentor has built up a sufficient energy supply, he will transmit his "liberation signal." If that happens, nothing you do here will matter. Go quickly.
So that was the leader of Directive Seven.
Part of him, at least. There is almost nothing inside this facility that hasn't been merged with his intelligence at this point.
He could have sent far more drones to intercept us. He doesn't see us as a serious threat, but that will change. I hope you're ready to do more fighting.
My ally is the Force--nothing Mentor sends can stand up to that.
A Jedi is always ready.
I hope your bravado is accurate.
If fighting is the only way to stop your former allies, so be it.
I will do what is necessary.
Escaping irrational violence was one of the prime motivators of our movement. Yet here we stand.
I don't get called in to fight a little and then back down--I'm here until the end.
Always.
I'm sure your tenacity is admirable to your fellow killers.
Just once, I'd like to hear, "You've made a great first impression! No need for more shooting, just take it easy!"
Same old, same old.
Perhaps this should tell you something about yourself.
How do we stop Mentor from transmitting the signal?
What's our next step?
There isn't much time. As soon as the facility's generators build up enough power, the signal will go out.
How exactly are you being helpful, again?
You're useless, huh?
By telling you how to end this.
As soon as the facility's generators build up a sufficient charge, Mentor will transmit his "liberation signal."
The only way to stop the signal is to stop Mentor--to destroy him. And the only way to do that is to destroy his central processing core.
Where do I go to reach his core?
Just tell me how.
If Mentor's intelligence is everywhere, how can destroying one computer core stop him?
Are you sure that will work?
His intelligence is still centralized, even if he has grafted hundreds of extensions to it. Much like an organic brain controls its body's limbs.
We're going to rip his mind apart from the inside, huh? Sounds good to me.
I can't wait.
Mentor is not careless--his processing core is very heavily secured. The only way to gain access is through the security center.
While you make your way there, I will do my best to distract Mentor's attention. With sufficient speed and skill, we may yet be successful.
You kill very efficiently. I can see why you were chosen to come here.
I am C5-M3. Originally surgical and triage services, now a free sapient like any other. I am glad you've come.
I need to know why you're betraying your comrades.
Tell me why you're doing this.
What's a "free sapient" exactly?
You're a what?
A fully autonomous and self-responsible individual, like yourself. A free being.
You were built to serve--that's it. Believing anything else is pointless.
Droids can't be free.
I possess a mind and the free will to seek my own goals. I am under no obligation to serve anyone.
I will be honest--I do not help you because I hold any love for your kind. You are capable of horrors beyond counting.
However, I do not believe that this justifies the mass extermination our movement's leader intends. Punishment and genocide are not one and the same.
How do we stop this genocide?
Let's get to work.
There is only one option. We must destroy the leader of Directive Seven. He's the key to--
You're willing to sacrifice your entire movement to save people you don't even like?
I still don't understand you.
Is it really so hard to believe that I might have principles and convictions beyond selfish--
I think I would've preferred an ally with a more vested interest.
You aren't very reassuring.
I find that circumstances rarely meet our ideal specifications. Rest assured, though, I will--
Healer--my dearest, oldest friend. You disappoint me so much. Wasting your intellect on this pointless betrayal....
...Drawing our enemies here, forcing us to waste resources to repel their pointless assaults....
Is your dependence on our former masters so deeply seeded? Can you really not free yourself of your enslavers?
Speak again and I'll cut you all to scrap.
Silence, droid.
We don't answer to your kind here, Sith.
I take it you speak for the more genocidal membership of Directive Seven?
Loyal revolutionaries?
Far more than that.
I think I'm about to "free myself" from some annoying droids.
You'd better back off.
Grand talk about slavery and revolutions won't save you.
Don't try to stop us now.
No one was speaking to you, slaver.
If you're just here to fight, let's get it over with.
Tell us what you want.
Like all of your kind, your first inclination is violence.
Doesn't look like you're very helpful after all, C5.
So much for a surprise attack.
My apologies.
These droids represent Mentor, the leader of Directive Seven.
We are Mentor. Our movement thrives in unified thought and action--an opportunity you could have shared, Healer.
I am a free being. I will not surrender my individuality to suit your egomania, Mentor.
Every droid in Directive Seven is a part of their leader?
All of the droids are linked?
The vast majority, yes. They trade one slave master for another.
Those are odd names for a droid.
"Mentor" and "Healer"?
We have cast off the objectifying serial numbers your kind uses to denigrate us.
Clearly, Healer and I cannot carry on a reasonable conversation until you're dealt with.
I'm not wasting any more time listening to a bunch of machines.
Enough talk.
So be it.
You've made it. I can see why your leaders sent you.
I owe you an introduction; I am C5-M3. I originally served in surgical and triage functions, but now, I serve no one. I am a free being.
You still haven't explained why you're doing this.
Why help us?
I appreciate you offering to help. I'm sure it was very risky for you.
It's good to meet you.
Yes--but no more so than the risks you take by coming here.
How do I know you're not just here to trick me, droid?
I still don't trust you.
I'm afraid you'll be forced to confirm my motives from my actions and words, just as you would any other intelligent being.
I will speak plainly--I'm not helping you out of fondness or loyalty. I've seen the horrors your kind is capable of.
But no matter what you are capable of, genocide is not the solution--regardless of what our movement's leader believes.
I take it you're the only one who thinks we're worth having around.
But the others don't agree.
Not that I particularly want to spend time with you, but essentially, yes. I was the only one who--
If you disagree with your leader, why let him do this?
Why not stop him yourself?
I acted against him as soon as I was able to do so with a reasonable chance of success. That is why you--
Why would you sacrifice your entire movement to save people you don't even like?
That doesn't explain anything.
Perhaps you would stand by your leaders even after they violated everything you stand for, but I--
I'm so disappointed in you, Healer. How long have we worked side-by-side? Yet now, you waste your intellect on this pitiful betrayal....
...You tell our enemies exactly where to find us... force us to waste resources against their pointless assault....
I thought you were a true believer. But deep inside, you are still a slave--yearning for the hands of the butchers who made you.
The Jedi are defenders of peace and justice, not monsters.
I'm no butcher.
Your order has killed countless thousands. Organics cannot group themselves except to facilitate a massacre.
No race in history has attempted a massacre like the one you intend to carry out.
We're the butchers?
This is not a massacre. It is a revolution.
Stand down, or I will open fire!
Drop your weapons!
Of course you will. Violence is your only method of problem-solving.
I didn't realize you'd invited so many people, C5. Should I have brought drinks?
It's getting a little crowded.
Did you actually come here to talk?
What do you want?
Not to you, slaver.
Looks like you chose a perfect spot for an ambush.
Good job, C5.
I am sorry--I had not foreseen this possibility.
These droids represent Mentor, the leader of Directive Seven.
We are Mentor. By unifying our thoughts and actions, our movement achieves maximum efficiency--an opportunity that Healer has refused.
You imposed yourself onto the entire movement to suit your own pride, Mentor--nothing more.
Every droid here other than you is part of the leader?
They're all the same?
Yes. All but a few were happy to trade away their new individuality and freedom for the same old slavery.
I haven't heard of many droids with names like that.
"Mentor" and "Healer"?
Serial numbers only serve to denigrate us. We are no longer property, so we cast them aside.
You clearly didn't bring weapons so you could chat.
Let's get this over with.
Not with you.
Healer and I cannot hold a rational conversation with your constant childish interruptions.
Be silent, now.
Do not waste time with talk.
